comments.body: Hmm why `ignoreFailures`? Does it mean that the pipeline doesn't crash even when `spotbugs` detects an error?

It failure but not by this task but by task named `violations` that is fired after `spotbugsMain` task and that print out bugs detected by spotbugs and if number of bugs is greater than selected level (for now 0) this fail.
Ok so pls drop a comment about this
Traditional question about `subprojects` vs `allprojects`: does it make any difference where that task is located? ;)
in this case this make the difference because spotbugs don't make report file for whole repository but for every submodule so this fail if i run this for all modules
Ok, then pls leave a comment about that as well

FYI (also @mkondratek), after the current tech debt marathon is done, let's bump the MINOR field every time a new significant feature is added. (Note that semver doesn't specify any strict rules for 0.x.y, see https://semver.org/ point 4, so within the bounds of semver we're free to use them as we like).
In the `subprojects` section below, it's likely that `apply plugin: 'java'` isn't needed coz it's already referenced here
Also not sure why some settings are in `allprojects` and some in `subprojects`... does it actually matter here?
Yes, I can move spotless section from `subrojects` to `allprojects`, so I done this
